message: I'm running an open space session Saturday evening, but *really* don't want to miss Testing BOF. Anyone know when it's planned?
http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/index/ - not sure, but I expect it to be on saturday night, as is tradition.
That's what I was afraid of. Don't want to clash.
terry peppers is on vacation. imagine we'll plan it more exactly when he gets back
Yeah, if it's a toss up between the testing BoF and anything else; I have to error on the side of the TiP BOF
@jessenoller I'm totally getting in line for the TiP BOF at the crack of dawn. Last year's was such a blast.
Paul Hildebrandt is planning on Saturday for the testing BOF - Disney wants to provide pizza again.
Yup, what Van said.  Terry and I talked a while ago and decided Sat night.  Anyone have a vague guess at how many people there may be attending?
@paulhildebrandt Did we have around 100 last year? I can't believe it will be smaller, after the stories.
Yeah, I'm extremely sad I missed it, so I'll be there!

Okay, I will up the pizza order.  I think I got around 30 pizzas last year.  Unless there is negative feedback I will order from http://www.mellowmushroom.com/ again.   If you have special dietary restrictions  msg me: Paul dot Hildebrandt  disney com
I <3 you paul. I am going to talk to Van and Ewa to see if we can get a "bigger" space then last year without trashing the vibe
I put more information about the TiP BOF on the PyCon site. http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/index/   we can grow that page as needed.

@doughellmann I believe there was more than 100.  People were standing and sitting all around the walls and spilling out the door because they couldn't physically enter the room.  I know some people who wanted to attend eventually gave up.
It was the best part of 2010. Wouldn't miss.

For some reason I forgot to turn around and take pictures of the whole room. It was packed! If you missed out, you may want to take a look at the pics: http://www.flickr.com/photos/aldegaz/sets/72157623357506507/

@holdenweb Sorry, getting back into the swing of things after vacation. Officially the TiP BoF will be on Saturday, March 12 @ 7:00 PM. Organizers should plan to meet @ 6:00 PM. There are active TiP BoF threads on the TiP mailing list and I finally put up a proper link to the TiP BoF on the PyCon 2011 site (http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/TestingBOF/).
OK, my open space session officially doesn't begin until Testing BOF ends. WHich may mean that it doesn't run at all. Why is there never enough time at PyCon?
This is my first pycon but it sounds like I shouldn't miss the testing BoF :P
PyCon *is* the TiP BoF + lightening talks...  The rest is optional.
sorry guys, but what what does BoF stand for?
@paulhildebrandt - if they have a gluten-free crust option, that'd be awesome!
@jamespaxi  "birds of a feather" - a get together of people all interested in a particular topic
I don't know what the difference between a BoF and an "open space" is though. None I suspect.
@voidspace bof is a disease in dutch and open space isn't ;)
@voidspace thanks for explaining that to me :)
@holdenweb Hi I just realised I need to put my name down if I wanna participate. Would it be ok if I participated as someone wanting to learn from others, rather than to discuss my thoughts?

@jamespaxi  - This might help cast a little distinction:  Openspaces are where people can run their own topics (called an "un-conference").   BoF's tend to be people w/ longer term interest so it's a good place to come to learn -  with some humor. If you see a lot interest in a BoF and it meets in the evening, expect a bit of a sense of a party - expect to learn some (work will get done) ... while having lots of fun.

@jamespaxi - the description (and video) at http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/ might help describe the idea of an openspace.  Our "openspaces" allow for that, traditional get-togethers, or good old-fashioned presentations (anything you want to try, which people will come to).

@yarkot thanks for clearing my mind on the topic. I have placed my name down on the list, it sounds like something I would really interested in participating :) Also it would be quite refreshing to speak with people who really care about what they do.
@jamespaxi Don't worry, there'll be a mix from beginners to old-timers. All welcome!
